content: emily scarf materials needed g 4 0mm crochet hook fingering weight yarn yarn needle the emily scarf is an asymmetrical triangle scarf with a gentle scoop to it to help it fit around the shoulders easy enough for a beginner all you need to know is to work a double_crochet stitch i have been a fan of the no turning chain double_crochet video on youtube since i learned how to do it therefore the pattern and chart both start with a double_crochet instead of a ch2 or ch3 if you do not know how to do the no turning chain double_crochet or simply prefer not to feel free to use ch2 or ch3 in place of the first stitch turn after each row row 1 in magic loop work 3dc row 2 2dc in first st double_crochet in next st 2dc in last st row 3 2dc in first st double_crochet in next 2 sts skip last 2 sts row 4 2dc in first st double_crochet in next 2 sts 2dc in last st row 5 2dc in first st double_crochet in next 3 sts skip last 2 sts row 6 2dc in first st double_crochet in next 3 sts 2dc in last st continue on in this way increasing the bolded sts by 1 every other row until scarf is to your desired length i worked mine to 53 points along the bottom edge but you may make yours longer or shorter as you wish finish on an even-numbered row finishing row 3dc in first st skip 2 sts * single_crochet in next 2 sts 3 double_crochet in same st as 2nd single_crochet skip 2 sts * repeat from * to * to the end of the row ending with a slip_stitch after final repeat may require a little fudging toward the end depending on your stitch count but it is not vital that your slip_stitch hits just the right spot weave in ends block well being sure to pin out the points so they look nice and pointy as always a crudely-drawn chart
